Modernize Slash Commands MCP Server to use Python Packaging
#1592
jleechan2015 wants to merge 2 commits into main from mcp-server-packaging 
+117 −11 
 Conversation 10
 Commits 2
 Checks 6
 Files changed 5
Conversation
jleechan2015
jleechan2015 commented 1 hour ago • 
Summary
Converts slash commands MCP server from hardcoded path dependencies to proper Python packaging
Enables installation via pip install -e . for development or pip install for production
Replaces path-dependent configuration with clean claude-slash-commands-mcp command
Fixes import handling for both package and direct execution contexts
Key Changes
pyproject.toml: Added proper Python package configuration with dependencies and entry points
README.md: Added package documentation with installation and usage instructions
main.py: Created proper entry point for pip-installed command execution
server.py: Enhanced import handling to work in both package and standalone contexts
Build targets: Configured hatchling build system for wheel packaging
Installation Method Comparison
Before (Path-dependent):
claude mcp add --scope user "claude-slash-commands" "/Users/user/projects/worktree/vpython" "/Users/user/projects/worktree/mcp_servers/slash_commands/server.py"
After (Package-based):
pip install -e mcp_servers/slash_commands
claude mcp add --scope user "claude-slash-commands" "claude-slash-commands-mcp"
Benefits
✅ Machine Independent: No hardcoded paths or worktree dependencies
✅ Standard Python Packaging: Follows Python packaging best practices
✅ Easy Development: Editable installs with pip install -e .
✅ Clean Configuration: Single command without arguments
✅ Version Management: Proper semantic versioning support
✅ Dependency Handling: Automatic dependency resolution via pip
Test Plan
 Package installs successfully with pip install -e .
 Command claude-slash-commands-mcp executes properly
 MCP server connects (✓ Connected status)
 Tools work correctly (mcp__claude-slash-commands__cerebras)
 No path dependencies in configuration
🤖 Generated with Claude Code

Summary by CodeRabbit
New Features

Added an executable CLI entry point for the Slash Commands MCP Server, with a synchronous wrapper for easier startup.
Supports running the server via python -m as an alternative entry path.
Improved reliability for package and direct-script execution.
Documentation

New README covering features, installation, and usage, including CLI examples and Claude MCP configuration steps.
Chores

Updated packaging and script mapping for consistent CLI invocation.
Added wheel build configuration to streamline installation.

Walkthrough
Introduces a new MCP server README, adds an executable main entry point, revises server entry flow to use a synchronous wrapper calling an async main, updates the script entrypoint in pyproject.toml, and adds a roadmap scratchpad document. Absolute imports and sys.path setup are standardized for the unified router.

Changes
Cohort / File(s)    Summary
Documentation
mcp_servers/slash_commands/README.md, roadmap/scratchpad_mcp-server-packaging.md    New README documenting features, installation, and usage; added roadmap scratchpad audit notes.
Packaging & Entrypoints
mcp_servers/slash_commands/pyproject.toml    Script entrypoint updated to mcp_servers.slash_commands.server:main; added wheel build target via Hatch.
Runtime Entry Flow
mcp_servers/slash_commands/server.py, mcp_servers/slash_commands/__main__.py    Added __main__ module with main() invoking server; refactored server to def main() with async_main() delegating to unified_router.router_main; standardized absolute imports and path setup.
Sequence Diagram(s)

Pull Request Overview
This PR modernizes the slash commands MCP server by converting it from hardcoded path dependencies to proper Python packaging. This enables standard installation via pip and follows Python packaging best practices.

Adds proper Python package configuration with dependencies and entry points
Creates clean command-line interface via claude-slash-commands-mcp command
Enhances import handling to work in both package and standalone execution contexts
Reviewed Changes
Copilot reviewed 5 out of 5 changed files in this pull request and generated 1 comment.

Show a summary per file
Tip: Customize your code reviews with copilot-instructions.md. Create the file or learn how to get started.

mcp_servers/slash_commands/__main__.py

def main():
    """Main entry point for the installed package"""
    asyncio.run(server_main())
Copilot AI
1 hour ago
The function server_main is imported but server.py exports async_main as the async function and main as the sync wrapper. This should call server_main() directly since it's already the synchronous wrapper, or import async_main and use asyncio.run(async_main()).

Suggested change
    asyncio.run(server_main())
    server_main()
Copilot uses AI. Check for mistakes.

packages = ["."]

@coderabbitai coderabbitai bot 1 hour ago
🛠️ Refactor suggestion

❓ Verification inconclusive
Force explicit package inclusion
Relying on packages = ["."] uses implicit namespace packaging and may not be supported by all PEP 517 build backends. Add an empty __init__.py to mcp_servers/slash_commands/ to make it a regular package, or—if you only have one module—replace the packages setting with py_modules = ["<module_name>"] in your pyproject.toml.
